creator: Security Geeks
descriptionHtml:
*******FOLLOW US ON*******
https://www.linkedin.com/company/deviceseal
*AND*
https://www.facebook.com/DeviceSeal-106047367624430/
https://www.facebook.com/groups/2371375336312917/
***TO RECEIVE THE LATEST UPDATES***
Check our YouTube channel for more info and security demonstrations
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCRTc8eGFDjuTMld0UB31_CA

There is no doubt that Automation is one on the top trends across all industries, Extending automation in all areas will be the main target in the next couple of years.
DeviceSeal brings automation to the End user to solve critical privacy and security problems without any trade-off on End User Experience.
DeviceSeal is a new APP that is aiming to combine the power of automation to fulfil complete user privacy in addition to seamless end user experience. DeviceSeal is an automated Mic and Camera blocker which ensures seamless end user experience where MIC/Camera are blocked when the device is in idle mode and released when the user starts using the mobile phone.

Privacy threats are mainly caused by:

1) Installing a malicious application
2) An intruder can illegally access the user phone then uses the granted permissions to any of the installed applications and starts using the Android device accordingly.

Most modern hacking attacks are following the model explained in point 2, as most malicious applications are either blacklisted by different android markets or flagged as potentially risky applications, leaving the user with limited choices to either uninstall most of the existing applications or deny the installed applications the required permissions which will eventually leave the android user isolated and lacking allot of the offered functionality by different applications

Mission and Vision

To protect the privacy of all android users by giving them full control on their Android devices
descriptionShort: Protection from unauthorised MIC/CAM access , uncompromised end user experience

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
1) Mic and Cam availability is linked to unlocking the phone by Pin/Pattern set by the user [in Sec Auto and Super Mode]
2) Quick setup notes in different languages are added together with simple visual aids
3) Links to updated setup videos added.
4) An enhanced GUI.
5) Application resilience is further enhanced to avoid APP crashes.
6) Support for Android 10

creator: ASY-SOFT-LTD
descriptionHtml:
Important notes
1) Release 3.105 introduced major changes, please go through the supporting videos/release notes
2) DeviceSeal should be whitelisted by any power management tool/Task killer
3) Setting DeviceSeal to Auto mode will keep Mic/Cam unsealed as long as the device is in use
4) Please refer to DeviceSeal channel for demonstration vids
5) To remove DeviceSeal, go to Settings, installed APPs, choose DeviceSeal then uninstall

title: DeviceSeal - Automatic Microphone / Camera Blocker

creator: ASY-SOFT-LTD
descriptionHtml:
Important notes
1) Release 3.105 introduced major changes, please go through the supporting videos/release notes and grant the Camera Privilege after upgrading to 3.105 release
2) The only Camera Blocker that works on Android 11 and does not use SDK 28 (depreciated version)
3) DeviceSeal should be whitelisted by any power management tool/Task killer
4) Setting DeviceSeal to Auto mode will keep Mic/Cam unsealed as long as the device is in use
5) Please refer to DeviceSeal channel for demonstration vids
6) To remove DeviceSeal, go to Settings, installed APPs, choose DeviceSeal then uninstall

2) Mic and Cam availability is linked to unlocking the phone by Pin/Pattern set by the user [in Sec Auto and Super Mode]
3) Quick setup notes in different languages are added together with simple visual aids
4) Links to updated setup videos added.
5) An enhanced GUI.
6) Application resilience is further enhanced to avoid APP crashes.

title: DeviceSeal - Automatic Microphone / Camera Blocker

creator: ASY-SOFT-LTD
descriptionHtml:
Important notes
1) Release 3.105 introduced major changes, please go through the supporting videos/release notes and grant the Camera Privilege after upgrading to 3.105 release
2) The only Camera Blocker that works on Android 11 and does not use old/obsolete Java versions which could add more risks
3) DeviceSeal should be whitelisted by any power management tool/Task killer
4) Setting DeviceSeal to Auto mode will keep Mic/Cam unsealed as long as the device is in use
5) Please refer to DeviceSeal channel for demonstration vids
6) To remove DeviceSeal, go to Settings, installed APPs, choose DeviceSeal then uninstall
7) In SEC-AUTO and Super Mode, DS GUI might pop up. Main is reason is due to an APP is trying to access your Camera, mainly happens when the screen is turned on while the phone is still secured (with a pin, pattern,..), also it may happen with Super mode when DS attempts to lock Mic/Cam while an APP is actively opening the Cam

There is no doubt that Automation is one on the top trends across all industries, Extending automation in all areas will be the main target in the next couple of years.
DeviceSeal brings automation to the End user to solve critical privacy and security problems without any trade-off on End User Experience.
DeviceSeal is a new APP that is aiming to combine the power of automation to fulfil complete user privacy in addition to seamless end user experience. DeviceSeal is an automated Mic and Camera blocker which ensures seamless end user experience where MIC/Camera are blocked when the device is in idle mode and released when the user starts using the mobile phone.

To uninstall DeviceSeal, go to Settings then to APPs then select DeviceSeal and uninstall,

Mission and Vision

To protect the privacy of all mobile users by giving them full control on their devices/phones
descriptionShort: Protection from unauthorised MIC/CAM access , uncompromised end user experience

descriptionShort: Protection from unauthorised MIC/CAM access , uncompromised end user experience

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
1) Different blocking modes, user has the choice to block Mic, Cam or Mic & Cam together (check the new features section)
2) CPU processing is decreased by 50%
3) Introducing the new Timer Mode (a specific security mode can be activated in a certain time window every day)

title: DeviceSeal - Automatic Microphone / Camera Blocker

creator: ASY-SOFT-LTD
descriptionHtml:
!!**Attention Android 11 users**!!

Starting from Android 11, DeviceSeal should be added to never sleeping Apps (Device Care => Battery => Background usage limits => Never Sleeping Apps)
(Device Care => Memory => Excluded APPs ) to ensure full protection.

!!**Attention Chinese Devices Owners**!!
Users having Chinese devices (with Android MUI) like Redmi,... should add DeviceSeal in excluded Apps as follows:

System Settings > Apps > Manage System Apps > Security > Boost Speed > Lock Apps, choose whatever apps you want it to run on background.

Then choose "Auto start" on the app's info.

Important notes
1) Release 3.105 introduced major changes, please go through the supporting videos/release notes and grant the Camera Privilege after upgrading to 3.105 release
2) The only Camera Blocker that works on Android 11 and does not use old/obsolete Java versions which could add more risks
3) DeviceSeal should be whitelisted by any power management tool/Task killer
4) Setting DeviceSeal to Auto mode will keep Mic/Cam unsealed as long as the device is in use
5) Please refer to DeviceSeal channel for demonstration vids
6) To remove DeviceSeal, go to Settings, installed APPs, choose DeviceSeal then uninstall
7) In SEC-AUTO and Super Mode, DS GUI might pop up. Main is reason is due to an APP is trying to access your Camera, mainly happens when the screen is turned on while the phone is still secured (with a pin, pattern,..), also it may happen with Super mode when DS attempts to lock Mic/Cam while an APP is actively opening the Cam
8) DeviceSeal GUI can be easily opened from the quick launcher menu

There is no doubt that Automation is one on the top trends across all industries, Extending automation in all areas will be the main target in the next couple of years.
DeviceSeal brings automation to the End user to solve critical privacy and security problems without any trade-off on End User Experience.
DeviceSeal is a new APP that is aiming to combine the power of automation to fulfil complete user privacy in addition to seamless end user experience. DeviceSeal is an automated Mic and Camera blocker which ensures seamless end user experience where MIC/Camera are blocked when the device is in idle mode and released when the user starts using the mobile phone.

To uninstall DeviceSeal, go to Settings then to APPs then select DeviceSeal and uninstall,

Mission and Vision

To protect the privacy of all mobile users by giving them full control on their devices/phones

descriptionHtml:
Have a peace of mind, one program does it all. Then choose "Auto start" on the app's info.

New Features:
1) Choose the blocking mode: MIC, CAM or MIC/CAM
2) Check the Timer mode, where it will be possible to change the security mode based on a pre-configured time window

Important notes
1) Release 3.105 introduced major changes, please go through the supporting videos/release notes and grant the Camera Privilege after upgrading to 3.105 release
2) The only Camera Blocker that works on Android 11 and does not use old/obsolete Java versions which could add more risks

7) In SEC-AUTO and Super Mode, DS GUI might pop up. Main reason is due to an APP is trying to access your Camera, mainly happens when the screen is turned on while the phone is still secured (with a pin, pattern,..), also it may happen with Super mode when DS attempts to lock Mic/Cam while an APP is actively opening the Cam
8) DeviceSeal GUI can be easily opened from the quick launcher menu

To uninstall DeviceSeal, go to Settings then to APPs then select DeviceSeal and uninstall,

Mission and Vision

To protect the privacy of all mobile users by giving them full control on their devices/phones

1) Record Audio, to block and unblock microphone
2) Record Video, to block and unblock Camera
3) Check phone status, to automatically detect calls
4) Appear on Top, to enable the Camera guard to block the camera against escalated attacks

Block and Unblock your Camera and/or Microphone according to your needs, all of this is done in an automated way with uncompromised end user experience . DeviceSeal will ensure the availability of MIC/CAM as explained in each security mode (check the listed Videos in DeviceSeal).

!!**Attention Android 11/12 users**!!

Starting from Android 11, DeviceSeal should be added to never sleeping Apps (Device Care => Battery => Background usage limits => Never Sleeping Apps)
(Device Care => Memory => Excluded APPs ) to ensure full protection.
APPs=> DeviceSeal=> battery => Optimise battery usage and DeviceSeal to (APPs not optimised) list.

!!**Attention Chinese Devices Owners**!!
Users having Chinese devices (with Android MUI) like Redmi,... should add DeviceSeal in excluded Apps as follows:

System Settings > Apps > Manage System Apps > Security > Boost Speed > Lock Apps, choose whatever apps you want it to run on background.

Then choose "Auto start" on the app's info.

New Features:
1) Choose the blocking mode: MIC, CAM or MIC/CAM
2) Check the Timer mode, where it will be possible to change the security mode based on a pre-configured time window

Important notes
1) Release 3.105 introduced major changes, please go through the supporting videos/release notes and grant the Camera Privilege after upgrading to 3.105 release
2) The only Camera Blocker that works on Android 11 and does not use old/obsolete Java versions which could add more risks
3) DeviceSeal should be whitelisted by any power management tool/Task killer
4) Setting DeviceSeal to Auto mode will keep Mic/Cam unsealed as long as the device is in use
5) Please refer to DeviceSeal channel for demonstration vids
6) To remove DeviceSeal, go to Settings, installed APPs, choose DeviceSeal then uninstall
7) In SEC-AUTO and Super Mode, DS GUI might pop up. Main reason is due to an APP is trying to access your Camera, mainly happens when the screen is turned on while the phone is still secured (with a pin, pattern,..), also it may happen with Super mode when DS attempts to lock Mic/Cam while an APP is actively opening the Cam
8) DeviceSeal GUI can be easily opened from the quick launcher menu

There is no doubt that Automation is one on the top trends across all industries, Extending automation in all areas will be the main target in the next couple of years.
DeviceSeal brings automation to the End user to solve critical privacy and security problems without any trade-off on End User Experience.
DeviceSeal is a new APP that is aiming to combine the power of automation to fulfil complete user privacy in addition to seamless end user experience. DeviceSeal is an automated Mic and Camera blocker which ensures seamless end user experience where MIC/Camera are blocked when the device is in idle mode and released when the user starts using the mobile phone.

To uninstall DeviceSeal, go to Settings then to APPs then select DeviceSeal and uninstall,

Mission and Vision

To protect the privacy of all mobile users by giving them full control on their devices/phones

DeviceSeal needs four main rights:

1) Record Audio, to block and unblock microphone
2) Record Video, to block and unblock Camera
3) Check phone status, to automatically detect calls
4) Appear on Top, to enable the Camera guard to block the camera against escalated attacks
descriptionShort: Automatic Camera Blocker and Automatic Microphone Blocker (DeviceSeal)

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
1) Different blocking modes, user has the choice to block Mic, Cam or Mic & Cam together (check the new features section)
2) Introducing the new Timer Mode (a specific security mode can be activated in a certain time window every day)
3) Introducing "SEAL" button, to lock MIC/CAAM
4) Ability to enable/disable MIC/CAM unlock in "DEFAULT" and "SUPER MODE"
5) Display MIC/CAM block status in notification area

2) DS has multiple security modes, to ensure full protection
3) DS allows the option to block, Microphone, Camera or both.
4) Using the timer mode, to change between security modes allows the user to choose different mode for a specific duration everyday.

!!**Attention Android 13 users**!!

Make sure to accept the show notification request, during installation, if rejected please remove and re-install again

!!**Attention Android 11/12 users**!!

Starting from Android 11, DeviceSeal should be added to never sleeping Apps (Device Care => Battery => Background usage limits => Never Sleeping Apps)
(Device Care => Memory => Excluded APPs ) to ensure full protection.
APPs=> DeviceSeal=> battery => Optimise battery usage and DeviceSeal to (APPs not optimised) list.

!!**Attention Chinese Devices Owners**!!
Users having Chinese devices (with Android MUI) like Redmi,... should add DeviceSeal in excluded Apps as follows:

System Settings > Apps > Manage System Apps > Security > Boost Speed > Lock Apps, choose whatever apps you want it to run on background.

Then choose "Auto start" on the app's info.

Introduction.

Have a peace of mind, one program does it all. Block and Unblock your Camera and/or Microphone according to your needs, all of this is done in an automated way with uncompromised end user experience . DeviceSeal will ensure the availability of MIC/CAM as explained in each security mode (check the listed Videos in DeviceSeal).

New Features:

1) Choose the blocking mode: MIC, CAM or MIC/CAM.
2) Check the Timer mode, where it will be possible to change the security mode based on a pre-configured time window.
3) Unlock MIC/CAM button is added to DS notification

Important notes
1) It is highly recommended to go through the supporting videos/release notes and grant the Camera Privilege after upgrading.
2) The only Camera Blocker that works on Android 12.
3) DeviceSeal should be whitelisted by any power management tool/Task killer
4) Setting DeviceSeal to Auto mode will keep Mic/Cam unsealed as long as the device is in use
5) Please refer to DeviceSeal channel for demonstration vids
6) In SEC-AUTO and Super Mode, DS GUI might pop up. Main reason is due to an APP is trying to access your Camera, mainly happens when the screen is turned on while the phone is still secured (with a pin, pattern,..), also it may happen with Super mode when DS attempts to lock Mic/Cam while an APP is actively opening the Cam
7) DeviceSeal GUI can be easily opened from the quick launcher menu

DeviceSeal brings automation to the End user to solve critical privacy and security problems without any trade-off on End User Experience.
DeviceSeal is a new APP that is aiming to combine the power of automation to fulfil complete user privacy in addition to seamless end user experience. DeviceSeal is an automated Mic and Camera blocker which ensures seamless end user experience where MIC/Camera are blocked when the device is in idle mode and released when the user starts using the mobile phone.

To uninstall DeviceSeal, go to Settings then to APPs then select DeviceSeal and uninstall,

Mission and Vision

To protect the privacy of all mobile users by giving them full control on their devices/phones

DeviceSeal needs four main rights:

1) Record Audio, to block and unblock microphone
2) Record Video, to block and unblock Camera
3) Check phone status, to automatically detect calls
4) Appear on Top, to enable the Camera guard to block the camera against escalated attacks
descriptionShort: DeviceSeal, Automatic Camera and Microphone Blocker

1) Choose the blocking mode: MIC, CAM or MIC/CAM.
2) Check the Timer mode, where it will be possible to change the security mode based on a pre-configured time window.
3) Unlock MIC/CAM button is added to DS notification

Important notes
1) It is highly recommended to go through the supporting videos/release notes.
2) The only Camera Blocker that works on Android 12.
3) DeviceSeal should be whitelisted by any power management tool/Task killer
4) Setting DeviceSeal to Auto mode will keep Microphone/Camera unsealed as long as the device is in use
5) In SEC-AUTO and Super Mode, DS GUI might pop up. Main reason is due to an APP is trying to access your Camera, this might happen when the screen is turned on while the phone is still secured (with a pin, pattern,..), also it may happen with Super mode when DS attempts to block Microphone/Camera while an APP is actively opening the Camera
6) DeviceSeal GUI can be easily opened from the quick launcher menu

DeviceSeal brings automation to the End user to solve critical privacy and security problems without any trade-off on End User Experience.
DeviceSeal is a new APP that is aiming to combine the power of automation to fulfil complete user privacy in addition to seamless end user experience. DeviceSeal is an automated Mic and Camera blocker which ensures seamless end user experience where Microphone/Camera are blocked when the device is in idle mode and released when the user starts using the mobile phone.

Mission and Vision

To protect the privacy of all mobile users by giving them full control on their devices/phones

DeviceSeal needs four main rights:

1) Record Audio, to block and unblock microphone
2) Record Video, to block and unblock Camera
3) Check phone status, to automatically detect calls
4) Appear on Top, to enable the Camera guard to block the camera against escalated attacks
descriptionShort: DeviceSeal, Camera blocker and microphone blocker for mobile security/privacy

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
1) New Unlock MIC/CAM & SET UNSEALED MODE button added in notification area
2) Support for multiple languages.
3) "Default mode" might not working on all Android 12 phones, it will function as "Super Mode".
4) Introducing the new Timer Mode (a specific security mode can be activated in a certain time window every day).
5) Introducing "SEAL" button, to lock MIC/CAM.

title: DS Microphone & Camera blocker

creator: ASY-SOFT-LTD
descriptionHtml:

A good practice is to check when the APP was last updated, if it turned out to be not updated for more than two years, then definitely this APP may include vulnerabilities (known as RCE).

APPs=> DeviceSeal=> battery => Optimise battery usage and DeviceSeal to (APPs not optimised) list.

System Settings > Apps > Manage System Apps > Security > Boost Speed > Lock Apps, choose whatever apps you want it to run on background. Then choose "Auto start" on the app's info.

1) Select security mode
2) Select blocking mode (Camera, Microphone or Camera & Microphone)

Pressing the home button will not disable the camera guard it will only send the camera guard to the background. Make sure to accept the show notification request, during installation, if rejected please remove and re-install again

Starting from Android 11, DeviceSeal should be added to never sleeping Apps (Device Care => Battery => Background usage limits => Never Sleeping Apps)
(Device Care => Memory => Excluded APPs ) to ensure full protection.
APPs=> DeviceSeal=> battery => Optimise battery usage and DeviceSeal to (APPs not optimised) list.

System Settings > Apps > Manage System Apps > Security > Boost Speed > Lock Apps, choose whatever apps you want it to run on background. Then choose "Auto start" on the app's info.

title:
GPS Camera Microphone blocker
4.408

creator: ASY-SOFT-LTD
descriptionHtml:
Why use DeviceSeal?
1) DeviceSeal offers over 2500 different security settings, allowing the user to customize the availability of Microphone, Camera, Location (change GPS) and Screen recording.
2) Unique security modes for blocking/unblocking Microphone and/or Camera, allowing users to control the availability of Microphone /Camera.
3) DS has a unique - yet simple, GPS location blocker (change GPS) feature, which overwrites GPS location and still allows the user to share the real GPS location when needed, controlling sharing the location is very important to avoid tracking the user location. DS can strictly control when should the location be available for sharing and allows the user to white-list specific application.
4) DS can be used to stop screen capturing/screen recording
5) Using the timer mode, to change between security modes allows the user to choose different mode for a specific duration every day.
6) DS can work in both manual mode (from the quick launch menu using Seal and unlock options) or an automated mode can be selected.
7) Using the Camera/Microphone white-listing features, will allow white-listing selected applications, just, click on the feature and wait till the list of applications is created (can take a couple of seconds) then choose the application that should be white-listed.
8) DeviceSeal uses the latest SW released by Google, It is always a good practice to make sure that the installed APP was recently updated by the developer, which ensures using the latest SW libraries recommended by Google, otherwise it makes no sense to deploy an APP using obsolete/vulnerable code. if it turned out to be not updated for more than two years, then definitely this APP may include vulnerabilities (known as RCE).
A kind reminder to watch the introduction video "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yy_HuFGvKH0"
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fUzpx6msSVE

and the Security modes video
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c3molw7mDLo

***Checkout the Active Microphone blocking mode to enable the use of voice commands while blocking the Microphone ****
***Checkout the new GPS Location Blocker feature****
***Checkout the new Camera/Microphone/Location White-listing feature****


How to use?
1) Select security mode, Security mode "UNSEALED" can be used together with Location blocking settings, for DeviceSeal to hide/change your location. Location white listing can be used to bypass the location blocker (change GPS).
2) Select blocking mode (Camera, Microphone or Camera & Microphone) in addition to enabling active Microphone blocking to allow the user to continue using voice commands while blocking the microphone.
3) Select the white-listed applications to bypass Microphone , Camera, and location blocking (change GPS).
4) Set the timer mode to activate different security mode in different time intervals.
5) Prevent screen recording/captures

Attention Android 13 users
Make sure to accept the show notification request, during installation, if rejected please remove and re-install again
Attention Android 11/12 users
Starting from Android 11, DeviceSeal should be added to never sleeping Apps (Device Care => Battery => Background usage limits => Never Sleeping Apps)
(Device Care => Memory => Excluded APPs ) to ensure full protection.
APPs=> DeviceSeal=> battery => Optimise battery usage and DeviceSeal to (APPs not optimised) list.
Attention Chinese Devices Owners
Users having Chinese devices (with Android MUI) like Redmi,... should add DeviceSeal in excluded Apps as follows:
System Settings > Apps > Manage System Apps > Security > Boost Speed > Lock Apps, choose whatever apps you want it to run on background. Then choose "Auto start" on the app's info.
Enable auto start option for DeviceSeal
